This is a minimal Python project for testing AI blame tracking. Here is what I found:

## Codebase Overview

**Project**: `ai-blame-test` - A test repository for AI blame tracking experiments

**Structure**:
- `/Users/cjm/repos/ai-blame-test/main.py` - Main entry point with a simple "Hello World" function
- `/Users/cjm/repos/ai-blame-test/pyproject.toml` - Modern Python project config using `uv` (as per your preferences)
- `/Users/cjm/repos/ai-blame-test/README.md` - Basic project description
- `/Users/cjm/repos/ai-blame-test/.python-version` - Python 3.13
- `/Users/cjm/repos/ai-blame-test/.gitignore` - Standard Python ignores

**Current State**:
- All files are untracked (new repository, no commits yet)
- Uses modern `uv` tooling with `hatchling` build backend
- Minimal starting point with just a `hello()` function

The project appears to be set up correctly following your preferences (uv, modern pyproject.toml). Ready for further development or testing.

### Critical Files for Implementation
- `/Users/cjm/repos/ai-blame-test/main.py` - Core application logic (currently minimal)
- `/Users/cjm/repos/ai-blame-test/pyproject.toml` - Project configuration and dependencies
- `/Users/cjm/repos/ai-blame-test/README.md` - Documentation
